group_1.textRight: Do you…think that's it?

group_1.textLeft: …I cannot say for certain.@I am younger than you, after all.
I have fewer years of life experience,
so please bear in mind that all I can offer you
are what I've learned thus far,@and my own personal opinions.

group_1.textRight: O-okay…

group_1.narration: "I believe that much of what makes us human@stems from the feeling of fondness."
"They say that what you are passionate about@in your childhood has a great impact on the rest of your life.@I myself feel as though my life has been sculpted@by my encounters with books."

group_1.textLeft: And it's become part of my identity.

group_1.textRight: Your…identity?

group_1.textLeft: What makes me who I am.

group_1.textRight: Ah, um… This is kinda complicated for me.
…What were you passionate about when you were@little?

group_1.textLeft: That-that'd have to be inline skating!

group_1.textRight: …The thing you loved in the past is what makes you@"you" today.
That's what Nemu meant… I think?

group_1.textLeft: Correct.

group_1.narration: "Miyuri Yukari,@your obsession with legs most likely stems@from inline skating."

"That was your original passion.@Over the course of your research,@you developed an interest in competitions.@But then your focus shifted to the legs of competitors,@and your interest took on a different form."
"Skating changed your tastes@and made you into the leg-lover you are today."
"That is to say, everythingー@including your love of skating and your fondness for legsー@are what makes you yourself."

group_1.textRight: So, um… Are you saying I'm gonna be gross@no matter what…?
…That's not it, Miyuri.
It's true that your feelings about legs
might've gotten distorted from their original@innocence, but…
…This all started because you wanted to skate well,
and then you ended up like this while studying@techniques, right?

group_1.textLeft: …Yeah.

group_1.textRight: Then there's nothing wrong with it at all.

group_1.textLeft: Huh…?

group_1.textRight: It's a result of how hard you worked@to become an athlete.

group_1.textLeft: B-but-but it's weird for me to like legs this much…!
| And what's the problem with that? |

group_1.textRight: [chara:103201:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]?!

group_1.textLeft: | Is it so wrong to be strange?@To be different from other people? |

group_1.textRight: Th-that's…

group_1.textLeft: There is nothing wrong with being different.
If it bothers others, though, that's another story.
It's not good for one's mental health to deny oneself@the things they love.
Isn't that somewhat disparaging to the subject?

group_1.textRight: I-I…didn't mean to…
But…I get how you feel.
I've gotten embarrassed because there are things@I'm "into" that I can't tell people about.
…Well, I still can't talk about it in public, but…
…Even so, lately I've made friends who don't care@about the sorts of things I like,
and are good to me anyway…
They made me realize that it's okay to like what I like,@you know…?
I'm sure your friends will accept you too, Miyuri.
…Maybe it's irresponsible to say,@but that's what I think.

group_1.textLeft: Rui…

group_1.textRight: And I mean, when I threw out the original stories@I wrote in the past,
I regretted it a lot, and it didn't make me move on@from being a geek.
That's when I realized:
All of this, including my hobbies, is a part of me.
Orー I am who I am@because of the things I like!

group_1.textLeft: Rui…
You've been talking a lot today, huh?

group_1.textRight: [chara:305601:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]?!
S-s-s-s-sorry! Geeks love talking about themselves.
Who's that supposed to help, right?@Sorry again.
A-and I even cut off Nemu… I'm really sorry…
Talk about the pot calling the kettle black…
Urgh, but I couldn't keep my mouth shut…

group_1.textLeft: No, you're more qualified to speak here,@especially on this subject.
Besides, I understand what you're saying.
Facing one's identity can make us feel ashamed@or conflicted,
and creative works are a place to expose@our sensitive sides.
It's more embarrassing than you can imagine.
And if it gets brought up in public,@the sense of shame is immeasurable.
However, if I stop exposing what's inside of me,
is it truly my work?
…Indeed, your excessive tastes may have annoyed
or troubled some of your friends.
I do think you should reflect on your behavior.
But is your enjoyment really something@that should be abandoned?
Can you honestly say you're "you"@if you've cast aside your identity?

group_1.textRight: It's true that my leg fetish
started because of my focus on legs in skating…
As an athlete, I felt like legs were something@important and precious.
Somewhere along the way, that love changed shape.
But it's still important to me!

group_1.textLeft: | So you aren't a pervert? |

group_1.textRight: I'm not, I'm not!
I just love skating, and I care about legs because@they're important for competing!
This love is nothing to be ashamed of.@I'm proud of it!
And the "me" who loves legs is Miyuri Yukari!
